sentences: Loftin relocated to Atlanta, Georgia and founded New Jeru Entertainment in January 1996 to produce soul, hip hop and R&B music.

He co-wrote, arranged and produced his first single "Custom Made (Give It To You)'" in 2000 for rapper Lil' Kim and followed up co-writing, arranging and producing for the soundtrack to the movie The Fast & The Furious where he collaborated with Murder, Inc.
The same year he co-produced for another motion picture, Osmosis Jones.
In 2014, he produced the instrumentals to W3P: Willy Wise Workout: 3 Degrees of Power for former world champion boxer, Willy Wise.
T.I., Motion Picture Soundtrack to The Longest Yard (2005)
Ander Taylor (vocals), Soundtrack to W3P DVD (Instrumental) (2014)
